posts.post_content:
Considering selling my PSA 2 Camnitz Lenox. Extremely clean and bold, very tuff & desirable rare back.

$1995 OBO.

Please PM me if interested, thanks.
Michael
Wowza! That is a great looking card for a 2.
Gotta love PSA that should at least be a 3.
I'm ignorant but I've got a coue 3.5's that don't look near that good.

Thanks for the kind words, guys. I agree! Hence the robust asking price...maybe someone can try to resubmit it, I just don't have the time.

Best-
M
There is a crease in the upper right corner of the card that looks like it was trying to be flattened out is why the card is graded a 2. It is though a nice looking Lenox. Good luck with the sale.
There's also a noticeable crease at the bottom of the card that has resulted in some paper loss on the front in "Pittsburg".

The flaws are obvious, yet rather subtle. Just for the record, i bought this card slabbed 3 years ago from another board member, i have not cracked it or touched the card in any way. it's bold, clean and rare.

Best-
M

PS- my goal is to get 8600 views in this thread. ;)

Bump ;)

Nice Lenox...good luck with the sale!

If I had an extra $2000 lying around, I would love to buy this card, but alas, I don't. That pose of Camnitz is one for which I've long had three tough backs (Sovereign 460, Cycle 460, and EPDG), and for which I've been thinking about working on a more systematic back run. I recently added a couple of the Sweet Caporal backs and the Piedmont.

David, one of the great thrills for me in this hobby is making friends and sharing this passion of cardboard. It's not always about the money when doing deals...shoot me a PM, knowing that you need it for a potential back run, I'll try my best to work with you on price.

Best-
Michael
Sorry no deals were able to be struck this week, thanks for all the PM's...it'll go to LOTG, along with some other killer rare backs (including an SGC 40 BL 350). Keep an eye out.
